unnormalised: **Telecom Giants Spar Over Data Plan Pricing in India**
normalised: **Telecom Giants Spar Over Data Plan Pricing in India**

unnormalised: Mumbai, October 26 – Leading Indian telecommunications providers are locked in a competitive battle over affordable data plans, impacting millions of consumers across the nation. Jio continues to disrupt the market with its aggressive pricing strategy, offering 2GB daily data plans for as low as Rs. 249 per month.
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty six – Leading Indian telecommunications providers are locked in a competitive battle over affordable data plans, impacting millions of consumers across the nation. J I O continues to disrupt the market with its aggressive pricing strategy, offering two gigabyte daily data plans for as low as rupee two hundred and forty nine per month.

unnormalised: Bharti Airtel and Vodafone Idea are scrambling to match these offers, focusing on bundled services like access to streaming platforms and Zee5 content. Analysts at the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi predict further consolidation in the market, with smaller players struggling to compete.
normalised: Bharti Airtel and Vodafone Idea are scrambling to match these offers, focusing on bundled services like access to streaming platforms and Z double E five content. Analysts at the Indian Institute of Technology (I I T) Delhi predict further consolidation in the market, with smaller players struggling to compete.

unnormalised: "The consumer is the ultimate king," said telecoms analyst, Priya Sharma. "This data war is reminiscent of the '90s cable TV boom, only this time it’s about internet access, as vital as 'Roti, Kapda, aur Makaan' these days."
normalised: "The consumer is the ultimate king," said telecoms analyst, Priya Sharma. "This data war is reminiscent of the nineties cable T V boom, only this time it’s about internet access, as vital as 'Roti, Kapda, aur Makaan' these days."

unnormalised: Some rural areas still lack adequate 4G coverage, despite the intense competition in urban centers like Delhi and Bangalore. Reliance Communications, though defunct, casts a long shadow on the industry, reminding everyone of the rapid boom-and-bust cycles possible in this sector. Recent debates have also surfaced on ensuring fair access to data for all, irrespective of economic background.
normalised: Some rural areas still lack adequate four G coverage, despite the intense competition in urban centers like Delhi and Bangalore. Reliance Communications, though defunct, casts a long shadow on the industry, reminding everyone of the rapid boom-and-bust cycles possible in this sector. Recent debates have also surfaced on ensuring fair access to data for all, irrespective of economic background.
